original_definition: 'microwave heating' means heating of food using electromagnetic energy;
generated_definition: 'microwave heating' means microwave heating refers to the use of electromagnetic waves in the microwave frequency range (typically between 300 mhz and 300 ghz) to heat or cook food or other materials.

Article 1: ovens which offer a ‘microwave heating’ function;
Article 2: ‘microwave heating’ means heating of food using electromagnetic energy;
